title: Docker build fails with "Could not open requirements file: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'travis/small-requirements.txt'"
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: MacOS 10.14.5 & Docker For Mac 2.0.0.3
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:  Dockerfiles
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.0.0
- **Python version**: N/A
- **npm version (if running the dev UI): N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
docker build  -t mlflow_dev .

### Describe the problem
docker build fails on `pip install -r test-requirements.txt` in the Dockerfiles.  Relevant error message:
```
Could not open requirements file: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'travis/small-requirements.txt'
The command '/bin/sh -c apt-get update && apt-get install -y default-libmysqlclient-dev build-essential &&      pip install -r dev-requirements.txt &&     pip install -r test-requirements.txt &&     pip install -e . &&     apt-get install -y gnupg &&     apt-get install -y openjdk-8-jre-headless &&     curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_10.x | bash - &&     apt-get update && apt-get install -y nodejs &&     cd mlflow/server/js &&     npm install &&     npm run build' returned a non-zero code: 1
```

### Source code / logs
Log from Docker build with --debug option 
[docker_build_pip_install_fails_with_debug.txt](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/3251739/docker_build_pip_install_fails_with_debug.txt)

Error can be reproduced by running `docker build -t mlflow_dev .`

### Root Cause Analysis
It appears that `travis` sub-directory was added to the `.dockerignore` file.  
```
.git
mlruns
docs
apidocs
mlflow.Rcheck
outputs
examples
travis              <<======
tests
node_modules
coverage
build
npm-debug.log*
yarn-debug.log*
yarn-error.log*
__pycache__
.*
~*
*.swp
*.pyc
```

As a result the `travis` directory does not appear to be added to the image.  This is confirmed by the debug messages generated during the docker build run.
```
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .DS_Store
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .cache
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .dockerignore
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .git
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .github
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .gitignore
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .idea
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: .travis.yml
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: __pycache__
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: docs
DEBU[0000] Skipping excluded path: examples
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: tests
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: travis     <<============
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .dockerignore
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .DS_Store
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .cache
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .git
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .github
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .gitignore
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .idea
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: .travis.yml
DEBU[0031] running session: v22kwxf5ikuu9sxrs0mqeoc4t
DEBU[0031] serving grpc connection
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: __pycache__
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: docs
DEBU[0031] Skipping excluded path: examples
DEBU[0057] Skipping excluded path: tests
DEBU[0057] Skipping excluded path: travis
Sending build context to Docker daemon  502.7MB
Step 1/4 : FROM continuumio/miniconda
 ---> e3b0fcc9f628
Step 2/4 : WORKDIR /app
 ---> Using cache
 ---> 078ca9c54c2e
```

I'll submit PR to remove travis from .dockerignore
